description: Seems to work the way it says it does. Pretty convenient place to launch all your games from.

one of the most useful game apps in the Linux world, congrats.
it helps me play all my favorite free games and I even managed to find new games that are part of the Linux gaming world. kudos.
summary: Wonderful contribution to the game world in Linux

description: It's like Linux steam. I find it to be fun. It was worth the click.
I like stuff that actually launches. For what ever reason, of which I do not care to investigate, it would not launch.
summary: Didn't work on my Debian 9 system

description: I dont know but for whatever reason this app is not launching on my archlinux system.
it keeps downloading after i pressed cancle 5 times and its getting annoying

After Lutris removed the “import” feature in their latest version of the app, a feature that allowed users to add/launch their software-center games in Lutris, I’ve been searching for a game launcher replacement that integrates well with software-center games. With Athenaeum, I’ve found the ideal replacement for Lutris.

What makes Athenaeum great is that it allows me to install, update, and launch all of my Flatpak games in one location. Not only does Athenaeum have all of the features of the gnome software-center (screenshots, description, developer links, etc.), but it also has a game recommendation system that’s similar to a platform like Steam. It makes discovering new games much more convenient in comparison with the gnome software-center.

The only downside with Athenaeum is that you can’t group games by Genre. 

Apart from the minor downside with genre-grouping, I strongly recommend Athenaeum. It’s the ideal game launcher for FOSS games.
summary: The ideal launcher for FOSS gamers

description: Contains a lot of FOSS games!

Lets not be disingenuous here - this doesn't replace Steam.

Its just a game launcher that has a bunch of FOSS games - THATS ALL.

Has no ability to Sign into steam, or act as a front end for Steam.
summary: Its NOT a replacement for Steam

description: No it's not a steam replacement however it is great for finding games to download. You could just use your normal repos but this is much nicer to use.

The programme starts, loads briefly and crashes before it can display anything.

I tested it on manjaro and kde neon with the same result.
Es un a aplicacion bastante buena
